comment.description: Comment for the zone; maximum 256 characters.

delegate_to.description: This provides information for the remote name server that maintains data for the delegated zone. The Infoblox appliance redirects queries for data for the delegated zone to this remote name server.

enable_rfc2317_exclusion.description: This flag controls whether automatic generation of RFC 2317 CNAMEs for delegated reverse zones overwrite existing PTR records. The default behavior is to overwrite all the existing records in the range; this corresponds to allow_ptr_creation_in_parent set to False. However, when this flag is set to True the existing PTR records are not overwritten.

ns_group.description: The delegation NS group bound with delegated zone.

prefix.description: The RFC2317 prefix value of this DNS zone. Use this field only when the netmask is greater than 24 bits; that is, for a mask between 25 and 31 bits. Enter a prefix, such as the name of the allocated address block. The prefix can be alphanumeric characters, such as 128/26 , 128-189 , or sub-B.

delegated_ttl.description: You can specify the Time to Live (TTL) values of auto-generated NS and glue records for a delegated zone. This value is the number of seconds that data is cached.

ms_managed.description: The flag that indicates whether the zone is assigned to a Microsoft DNS server. This flag returns the authoritative name server type of the Microsoft DNS server. Valid values are: NONE if the zone is not assigned to any Microsoft DNS server. STUB if the zone is assigned to a Microsoft DNS server as a stub zone. AUTH_PRIMARY if only the primary server of the zone is a Microsoft DNS server. AUTH_SECONDARY if only the secondary server of the zone is a Microsoft DNS server. AUTH_BOTH if both the primary and secondary servers of the zone are Microsoft DNS servers.

display_domain.description: The displayed name of the DNS zone.

ms_ddns_mode.description: Determines whether an Active Directory-integrated zone with a Microsoft DNS server as primary allows dynamic updates. Valid values are: SECURE if the zone allows secure updates only. NONE if the zone forbids dynamic updates. ANY if the zone accepts both secure and nonsecure updates. This field is valid only if ms_managed is either AUTH_PRIMARY or AUTH_BOTH. If the flag ms_ad_integrated is false, the value SECURE is not allowed.

ms_ad_integrated.description: The flag that determines whether Active Directory is integrated or not. This field is valid only when ms_managed is STUB, AUTH_PRIMARY, or AUTH_BOTH.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

using_srg_associations.description: This is true if the zone is associated with a shared record group.

ms_read_only.description: Determines if a Grid member manages the zone served by a Microsoft DNS server in read-only mode. This flag is true when a Grid member manages the zone in read-only mode, false otherwise. When the zone has the ms_read_only flag set to True, no changes can be made to this zone.

parent.description: The parent zone of this zone. Note that when searching for reverse zones, the in-addr.arpa notation should be used.

disable.description: Determines whether a zone is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the zone is enabled.

address.description: The IP address of the server that is serving this zone.

dns_fqdn.description: The name of this DNS zone in punycode format. For a reverse zone, this is in address/cidr format. For other zones, this is in FQDN format in punycode format.

locked.description: If you enable this flag, other administrators cannot make conflicting changes. This is for administration purposes only. The zone will continue to serve DNS data even when it is locked.

locked_by.description: The name of a superuser or the administrator who locked this zone.

fqdn.description: The name of this DNS zone. For a reverse zone, this is in address/cidr format. For other zones, this is in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format. Note that for a reverse zone, the corresponding zone_format value should be set.

ms_sync_master_name.description: The name of MS synchronization master for this zone.

zone_format.description: Determines the format of this zone.

mask_prefix.description: IPv4 Netmask or IPv6 prefix for this zone.

view.description: The name of the DNS view in which the zone resides. Example external.

comment.description: Comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

creator.description: The record creator. Note that changing creator from or to 'SYSTEM' value is not allowed.

creation_time.description: The time of the record creation in Epoch seconds format.

ddns_protected.description: Determines if the DDNS updates for this record are allowed or not.

ms_ad_user_data.description: The Microsoft Active Directory user related information.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

shared_record_group.description: The name of the shared record group in which the record resides. This field exists only on db_objects if this record is a shared record.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

discovered_data.description: The discovered data for this A record.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

forbid_reclamation.description: Determines if the reclamation is allowed for the record or not.

disable.description: Determines if the record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.

ddns_principal.description: The GSS-TSIG principal that owns this record.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

remove_associated_ptr.description: Delete option that indicates whether the associated PTR records should be removed while deleting the specified A record.

name.description: Name for A record in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format.

reclaimable.description: Determines if the record is reclaimable or not.

dns_name.description: The name for an A record in punycode format.

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the record.

view.description: The name of the DNS view in which the record resides. Example: external.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

discover_now_status.description: The discovery status of this Host Address.

use_for_ea_inheritance.description: Set this to True when using this host address for EA inheritance.

ms_ad_user_data.description: The Microsoft Active Directory user related information.

network.description: The network of the host address, in FQDN/CIDR format.

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on the this host address. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the dhcpd configuration file.

ignore_client_requested_options.description: If this field is set to false, the appliance returns all DHCP options the client is eligible to receive, rather than only the list of options the client has requested.

bootfile.description: The name of the boot file the client must download.

pxe_lease_time.description: The lease time for PXE clients, see *enable_pxe_lease_time* for more information.

reserved_interface.description: The reference to the reserved interface to which the device belongs.

configure_for_dhcp.description: Set this to True to enable the DHCP configuration for this host address.

nextserver.description: The name in FQDN format and/or IPv4 Address of the next server that the host needs to boot.

mac.description: The MAC address for this host address.

enable_pxe_lease_time.description: Set this to True if you want the DHCP server to use a different lease time for PXE clients. You can specify the duration of time it takes a host to connect to a boot server, such as a TFTP server, and download the file it needs to boot. For example, set a longer lease time if the client downloads an OS (operating system) or configuration file, or set a shorter lease time if the client downloads only configuration changes. Enter the lease time for the preboot execution environment for hosts to boot remotely from a server.

match_client.description: Set this to 'MAC_ADDRESS' to assign the IP address to the selected host, provided that the MAC address of the requesting host matches the MAC address that you specify in the field. Set this to 'RESERVED' to reserve this particular IP address for future use, or if the IP address is statically configured on a system (the Infoblox server does not assign the address from a DHCP request).

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which the host address resides.

discovered_data.description: The discovered data for this Host Address.

deny_bootp.description: Set this to True to disable the BOOTP settings and deny BOOTP boot requests.

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the host.

host.description: The host to which the host address belongs, in FQDN format. It is only present when the host address object is not returned as part of a host.

bootserver.description: The IP address or hostname of the boot file server where the boot file is stored.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

is_invalid_mac.description: This flag reflects whether the MAC address for this host address is invalid.

comment.description: Comment for the Stub Member Name Server Group; maximum 256 characters.

stub_members.description: The Grid member servers of this stub zone. Note that the lead/stealth/grid_replicate/ preferred_primaries/override_preferred_primaries fields of the struct will be ignored when set in this field.

name.description: The name of the Stub Member Name Server Group.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

comment.description: Comment for the DDNS Principal Cluster Group.

clusters.description: The list of equivalent DDNS principal clusters.

name.description: The name of this DDNS Principal Cluster Group.

comment.description: Comment for the Forward Stub Server Name Server Group; maximum 256 characters.

name.description: The name of this Forward Stub Server Name Server Group.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

comment.description: Comment for this shared record; maximum 256 characters.

name.description: Name for this shared record. This value can be in unicode format.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for this shared record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the shared record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the shared record should not be cached.

dns_name.description: The name for this shared record in punycode format.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

disable.description: Determines if this shared record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.

dns_mail_exchanger.description: The name of the mail exchanger in punycode format.

mail_exchanger.description: The name of the mail exchanger in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format.

shared_record_group.description: The name of the shared record group in which the record resides.

preference.description: The preference value. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

certificate_data.description: Hex dump of either raw data for matching type 0, or the hash of the raw data for matching types 1 and 2.

comment.description: Comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

matched_type.description: Specifies how the certificate association is presented. Based on RFC-6698.

name.description: The TLSA record name in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

creator.description: The record creator. Note that changing creator from or to 'SYSTEM' value is not allowed.

dns_name.description: The name of the TLSA record in punycode format.

ttl.description: The Time to Live (TTL) value for the record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

selector.description: Specifies which part of the TLS certificate presented by the server will be matched against the association data. Based on RFC-6698.

disable.description: Determines if the record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.

certificate_usage.description: Specifies the provided association that will be used to match the certificate presented in the TLS handshake. Based on RFC-6698.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

view.description: The name of the DNS view in which the record resides. Example: external.

name.description: The name of the DHCID record in FQDN format.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

creator.description: The record creator.

dns_name.description: The name for the DHCID record in punycode format.

creation_time.description: The creation time of the record.

dhcid.description: The Base64 encoded DHCP client information.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for the record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

view.description: The name of the DNS view in which the record resides. Example: external.

comment.description: Comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

creator.description: The record creator. Note that changing creator from or to 'SYSTEM' value is not allowed.

creation_time.description: The time of the record creation in Epoch seconds format.

ddns_protected.description: Determines if the DDNS updates for this record are allowed or not.

ttl.description: The Time to Live (TTL) value for the NAPTR record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

forbid_reclamation.description: Determines if the reclamation is allowed for the record or not.

disable.description: Determines if the record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.

ddns_principal.description: The GSS-TSIG principal that owns this record.

preference.description: The preference of the NAPTR record. The preference field determines the order NAPTR records are processed when multiple records with the same order parameter are present. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

services.description: The services field of the NAPTR record object; maximum 128 characters. The services field contains protocol and service identifiers, such as http+E2U or SIPS+D2T.

regexp.description: The regular expression-based rewriting rule of the NAPTR record. This should be a POSIX compliant regular expression, including the substitution rule and flags. Refer to RFC 2915 for the field syntax details.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

name.description: The name of the NAPTR record in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format.

reclaimable.description: Determines if the record is reclaimable or not.

dns_name.description: The name of the NAPTR record in punycode format.

flags.description: The flags used to control the interpretation of the fields for an NAPTR record object. Supported values for the flags field are U, S, P and A.

view.description: The name of the DNS view in which the record resides. Example: external.

dns_replacement.description: The replacement field of the NAPTR record in punycode format.

order.description: The order parameter of the NAPTR records. This parameter specifies the order in which the NAPTR rules are applied when multiple rules are present. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

replacement.description: The replacement field of the NAPTR record object. For nonterminal NAPTR records, this field specifies the next domain name to look up. This value can be in unicode format.

status.description: The scavenging process status. This is a read-only attribute.

processed_records.description: The number of processed during scavenging resource records.

reclaimed_records.description: The number of reclaimed during the scavenging process resource records.

associated_object.description: The reference to the object associated with the scavenging task.

reclaimable_records.description: The number of resource records that are allowed to be reclaimed during the scavenging process.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

name.description: The name of the NSEC record in FQDN format.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

creator.description: Creator of the record.

dns_name.description: Name for an NSEC record in punycode format.

creation_time.description: Time that the record was created.

next_owner_name.description: Name of the next owner that has authoritative data or that contains a delegation point NS record.

rrset_types.description: The RRSet types that exist at the original owner name of the NSEC RR.

dns_next_owner_name.description: Name of the next owner in punycode format.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for the record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

view.description: The name of the DNS View in which the record resides. Example: external.

comment.description: Comment for the name server group; maximum 256 characters.

use_external_primary.description: This flag controls whether the group is using an external primary. Note that modification of this field requires passing values for grid_secondaries and external_primaries.

name.description: The name of this name server group.

grid_primary.description: The grid primary servers for this group.

external_primaries.description: The list of external primary servers.

external_secondaries.description: The list of external secondary servers.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

is_multimaster.description: Determines if the multiple DNS primaries feature is enabled for the group.

is_grid_default.description: Determines if this name server group is the Grid default.

grid_secondaries.description: The list with Grid members that are secondary servers for this group.

comment.description: The descriptive comment.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

reverse.description: The reverse flag of the BulkHost record.

network_view.description: The network view associated with the bulk host view.

template_format.description: The bulk host name template format.

end_addr.description: The last IP address in the address range for the bulk host.

start_addr.description: The first IP address in the address range for the bulk host.

prefix.description: The prefix for the bulk host. The prefix is the name (or a series of characters) inserted at the beginning of each host name.

disable.description: The disable flag of a DNS BulkHost record.

zone.description: The zone name.

ttl.description: The Time to Live (TTL) value.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

policy.description: The hostname policy for records under the bulk host parent zone.

view.description: The view for the bulk host.

cloud_info.description: The cloud API related information.

dns_prefix.description: The prefix, in punycode format, for the bulk host.

template_name.description: The name of bulk host name template.

is_grid_default.description: True if this template is Grid default.

pre_defined.description: True if this is a pre-defined template, False otherwise.

template_format.description: The format of bulk host name template. It should follow certain rules (please use Administration Guide as reference).

comment.description: The descriptive comment for the DNS64 synthesis group object.

name.description: The name of the DNS64 synthesis group object.

clients.description: Access Control settings that contain IPv4 and IPv6 DNS clients and networks to which the DNS server is allowed to send synthesized AAAA records with the specified IPv6 prefix.

enable_dnssec_dns64.description: Determines whether the DNS64 synthesis of AAAA records is enabled for DNS64 synthesis groups that request DNSSEC data.

prefix.description: The IPv6 prefix used for the synthesized AAAA records. The prefix length must be /32, /40, /48, /56, /64 or /96, and all bits beyond the specified length must be zero.

disable.description: Determines whether the DNS64 synthesis group is disabled.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

exclude.description: Access Control settings that contain IPv6 addresses or prefix ranges that cannot be used by IPv6-only hosts, such as IP addresses in the ::ffff:0:0/96 network. When DNS server retrieves an AAAA record that contains an IPv6 address that matches an excluded address, it does not return the AAAA record. Instead it synthesizes an AAAA record from the A record.

mapped.description: Access Control settings that contain IPv4 addresses and networks for which the DNS server can synthesize AAAA records with the specified prefix.

is_default.description: True if the policy is the Grid default.

replacement_character.description: The replacement character for symbols in hostnames that do not conform to the hostname policy.

pre_defined.description: Determines whether the policy is a predefined one.

name.description: The name of a hostname rewrite policy object.

valid_characters.description: The set of valid characters represented in string format.

comment.description: The descriptive comment of this shared record group.

name.description: The name of this shared record group.

record_name_policy.description: The record name policy of this shared record group.

zone_associations.description: The list of zones associated with this shared record group.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

timestamp.description: The time when the DNS integrity check was last run for this zone.

zone.description: The reference of the zone during a search. Otherwise, this is the zone object of the zone to which the discrepancy refers.

severity.description: The severity of the discrepancy reported.

comment.description: The record comment.

name.description: The name of the record.

reclaimable.description: Determines if the record is reclaimable or not.

creator.description: The record creator.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for which the record is valid or being cached. The 32-bit unsigned integer represents the duration in seconds. Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

ddns_protected.description: Determines if the DDNS updates for this record are allowed or not.

record.description: The record object, if supported by the WAPI. Otherwise, the value is None.

disable.description: The disable value determines if the record is disabled or not. False means the record is enabled.

ddns_principal.description: The GSS-TSIG principal that owns this record.

zone.description: Name of the zone in which the record resides.

type.description: The record type. When searching for an unspecified record type, the search is performed for all records. On retrieval, the appliance returns UNSUPPORTED for unsupported records.

view.description: Name of the DNS View in which the record resides.

comment.description: The comment for the delegated NS group.

delegate_to.description: The list of delegated servers for the delegated NS group.

name.description: The name of the delegated NS group.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

discover_now_status.description: The discovery status of this IPv6 Host Address.

auto_create_a_and_ptr_for_lan2.description: Determines if the auto-generation of A and PTR records for the LAN2 IP address is enabled or not, if DNS service is enabled on LAN2.

allow_transfer.description: Allows or rejects zone transfers from specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks or allows transfers from hosts authenticated by Transaction signature (TSIG) key. This setting overrides the Grid zone transfer settings.

use_dns_health_check.description: Use flag for: dns_health_check_domain_list , dns_health_check_recursion_flag, dns_health_check_anycast_control, enable_dns_health_check, dns_health_check_interval, dns_health_check_timeout, dns_health_check_retries

comment.description: Comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

name.description: The Unknown record name in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

creator.description: The record creator. Note that changing creator from or to 'SYSTEM' value is not allowed.

dns_name.description: The name of the unknown record in punycode format.

ttl.description: The Time to Live (TTL) value for the record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

record_type.description: Specifies type of unknown resource record.

disable.description: Determines if the record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.

display_rdata.description: Standard textual representation of the RDATA.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

policy.description: The host name policy for the record.

subfield_values.description: The list of rdata subfield values of unknown resource record.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

enable_host_name_policy.description: Determines if host name policy is applicable for the record.

view.description: The name of the DNS view in which the record resides. Example: external.

enable_excluded_domain_names.description: Determines if excluding domain names from captured DNS queries and responses is enabled or disabled.

ddns_restrict_static.description: Determines if an option to restrict DDNS update request to resource records which are marked as 'STATIC' is enabled or disabled.

transfer_excluded_servers.description: The list of excluded DNS servers during zone transfers.

notify_delay.description: Specifies with how many seconds of delay the notify messages are sent to secondaries.

syslog_facility.description: The syslog facility. This is the location on the syslog server to which you want to sort the DNS logging messages.

allow_query.description: Determines if queries from the specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks are allowed or not. The appliance can also use Transaction Signature (TSIG) keys to authenticate the queries.

refresh_timer.description: The refresh time. This interval tells the secondary how often to send a message to the primary for a zone to check that its data is current, and retrieve fresh data if it is not.

enable_dns64.description: Determines if the DNS64 support is enabled or not.

dnssec_nxdomain_enabled.description: Determines if the NXDOMAIN rules for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

blacklist_log_query.description: Determines if blacklist redirection queries are logged or not.

enable_notify_source_port.description: Determines if the notify source port at the Grid Level is enabled or not.

dns_cache_acceleration_ttl.description: The minimum TTL value, in seconds, that a DNS record must have in order for it to be cached by the DNS Cache Acceleration service. An integer from 1 to 65000 that represents the TTL in seconds.

rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv6.description: The minimum prefix length for IPv6 RPZ-IP triggers. The appliance ignores RPZ-IP triggers with prefix lengths less than the specified minimum IPv6 prefix length.

server_id_directive.description: The value of the server-id directive for BIND and Unbound DNS.

filter_aaaa_list.description: The list of IPv4 addresses and networks from which queries are received. AAAA filtering is applied to these addresses.

default_ttl.description: The default TTL value of a Grid DNS object. This interval tells the secondary how long the data can be cached.

nsgroups.description: A name server group is a collection of one primary DNS server and one or more secondary DNS servers.

recursive_query_list.description: The list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses, networks or hosts authenticated by Transaction signature (TSIG) key from which recursive queries are allowed or denied.

transfers_in.description: The number of maximum concurrent transfers for the Grid. Valid values are unsigned integer between 10 and 10000, inclusive.

dnssec_enabled.description: Determines if the DNS security extension is enabled or not.

anonymize_response_logging.description: Determines if the anonymization of captured DNS responses is enabled or disabled.

dnssec_negative_trust_anchors.description: A list of zones for which the server does not perform DNSSEC validation.

enable_ftc.description: Determines whether Fault Tolerant Caching (FTC) is enabled.

dns_health_check_domain_list.description: The list of domain names for the DNS health check.

bind_hostname_directive.description: The value of the hostname directive for BIND.

default_bulk_host_name_template.description: Default bulk host name of a Grid DNS.

enable_query_rewrite.description: Determines if the DNS query rewrite is enabled or not.

forwarders.description: The forwarders for the member. A forwarder is essentially a name server to which other name servers first send all of their off-site queries. The forwarder builds up a cache of information, avoiding the need for the other name servers to send queries off-site.

blacklist_redirect_addresses.description: The IP addresses the appliance includes in the response it sends in place of a blacklisted IP address.

transfer_format.description: The BIND format for a zone transfer. This provides tracking capabilities for single or multiple transfers and their associated servers.

bulk_host_name_templates.description: The list of bulk host name templates. There are four Infoblox predefined bulk host name templates. Template Name Template Format Four Octets -$1-$2-$3-$4 Three Octets -$2-$3-$4 Two Octets -$3-$4 One Octet -$4

dns_query_capture_file_time_limit.description: The time limit (in minutes) for the DNS query capture file.

nxdomain_redirect_addresses.description: The list of IPv4 NXDOMAIN redirection addresses.

dns_health_check_anycast_control.description: Determines if the anycast failure (BFD session down) is enabled on member failure or not.

dnssec_expired_signatures_enabled.description: Determines when the DNS member accepts expired signatures.

query_rewrite_prefix.description: The domain name prefix for DNS query rewrite.

max_ncache_ttl.description: The maximum time (in seconds) for which the server will cache negative (NXDOMAIN) responses. The maximum allowed value is 604800.

query_source_port.description: The source port for queries. Specifying a source port number for recursive queries ensures that a firewall will allow the response. Valid values are between 1 and 63999. The default is picked by BIND.

store_locally.description: Determines if the storage of query capture reports on the appliance is enabled or disabled.

ddns_principal_group.description: The DDNS Principal cluster group name.

retry_timer.description: The retry time. This interval tells the secondary how long to wait before attempting to recontact the primary after a connection failure occurs between the two servers.

blackhole_list.description: The list of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks from which DNS queries are blocked.

zone_deletion_double_confirm.description: Determines if the double confirmation during zone deletion is enabled or not.

enable_blacklist.description: Determines if a blacklist is enabled or not.

enable_delete_associated_ptr.description: Determines if the ability to automatically remove associated PTR records while deleting A or AAAA records is enabled or not.

lame_ttl.description: The number of seconds to cache lame delegations or lame servers.

allow_bulkhost_ddns.description: Determines if DDNS bulk host is allowed or not.

root_name_server_type.description: Determines the type of root name servers.

response_rate_limiting.description: The response rate limiting settings for the member.

resolver_query_timeout.description: The recursive query timeout for the member.

dns64_groups.description: The list of DNS64 synthesis groups associated with this Grid DNS object.

email.description: The email address of a Grid DNS object.

blacklist_rulesets.description: The DNS Ruleset object names assigned at the Grid level for blacklist redirection.

dnssec_dns64_enabled.description: Determines if the DNS64 groups for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

custom_root_name_servers.description: The list of customized root nameserver(s). You can use Internet root name servers or specify host names and IP addresses of custom root name servers.

max_udp_size.description: The value is used by authoritative DNS servers to never send DNS responses larger than the configured value. The value should be between 512 and 4096 bytes. The recommended value is between 512 and 1220 bytes.

enable_client_subnet_recursive.description: Determines whether to enable adding EDNS client subnet options in recursive resolution.

excluded_domain_names.description: The list of domains that are excluded from DNS query and response capture.

ddns_principal_tracking.description: Determines if the DDNS principal track is enabled or disabled.

ddns_force_creation_timestamp_update.description: Defines whether creation timestamp of RR should be updated ' when DDNS update happens even if there is no change to ' the RR.

enable_blackhole.description: Determines if the blocking of DNS queries is enabled or not.

rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv4.description: The minimum prefix length for IPv4 RPZ-IP triggers. The appliance ignores RPZ-IP triggers with prefix lengths less than the specified minimum IPv4 prefix length.

nxdomain_rulesets.description: The Ruleset object names assigned at the Grid level for NXDOMAIN redirection.

allow_recursive_query.description: Determines if the responses to recursive queries are enabled or not.

transfers_out.description: The number of maximum outbound concurrent zone transfers. Valid values are unsigned integer between 10 and 10000, inclusive.

dnssec_rpz_enabled.description: Determines if the RPZ policies for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

client_subnet_domains.description: The list of zone domain names that are allowed or forbidden for EDNS client subnet (ECS) recursion.

member_secondary_notify.description: Determines if Grid members that are authoritative secondary servers are allowed to send notification messages to external name servers, if the Grid member that is primary for a zone fails or loses connectivity.

forward_only.description: Determines if member sends queries to forwarders only. When the value is true, the member sends queries to forwarders only, and not to other internal or Internet root servers.

enable_capture_dns_responses.description: Determines if the capture of DNS responses is enabled or disabled.

nxdomain_redirect.description: Determines if NXDOMAIN redirection is enabled or not.

allow_update.description: Determines if dynamic updates from specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses, networks or from host authenticated by TSIG key are allowed or not.

check_names_for_ddns_and_zone_transfer.description: Determines whether the application of BIND check-names for zone transfers and DDNS updates are enabled.

dns_health_check_retries.description: The number of DNS health check retries.

bind_check_names_policy.description: The BIND check names policy, which indicates the action the appliance takes when it encounters host names that do not comply with the Strict Hostname Checking policy. This method applies only if the host name restriction policy is set to Strict Hostname Checking.

negative_ttl.description: The negative TTL value of a Grid DNS object. This interval tells the secondary how long data can be cached for Does Not Respond responses.

enable_gss_tsig.description: Determines whether all appliances in the Grid are enabled to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated updates from DNS clients.

dtc_topology_ea_list.description: The DTC topology extensible attribute definition list. When configuring a DTC topology, users may configure classification as either Geographic or Extensible Attributes. Selecting extensible attributes will replace supported Topology database labels (Continent, Country, Subdivision, City) with the names of the selection EA types and provide values extracted from DHCP Network Container, Network and Range objects with those extensible attributes.

enable_dnstap_queries.description: Determines whether the query messages need to be forwarded to DNSTAP or not.

nxdomain_log_query.description: Determines if NXDOMAIN redirection queries are logged or not.

enable_capture_dns_queries.description: Determines if the capture of DNS queries is enabled or disabled.

enable_dnstap_responses.description: Determines whether the response messages need to be forwarded to DNSTAP or not.

forward_updates.description: Determines if secondary servers is allowed to forward updates to the DNS server or not.

disable_edns.description: Determines if the EDNS0 support for queries that require recursive resolution on Grid members is enabled or not.

dtc_edns_prefer_client_subnet.description: Determines whether to prefer the client address from the edns-client-subnet option for DTC or not.

ddns_restrict_secure.description: Determines if DDNS update request for principal other than target resource record's principal is restricted.

capture_dns_queries_on_all_domains.description: Determines if the capture of DNS queries for all domains is enabled or disabled.

client_subnet_ipv4_prefix_length.description: Default IPv4 Source Prefix-Length used when sending queries with EDNS client subnet option.

dnssec_blacklist_enabled.description: Determines if the blacklist rules for DNSSEC-enabled clients are enabled or not.

query_rewrite_domain_names.description: The list of domain names that trigger DNS query rewrite.

enable_hsm_signing.description: Determines whether Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) are enabled for key generation and signing. Note, that you must configure the HSM group with at least one enabled HSM.

dnssec_validation_enabled.description: Determines if the DNS security validation is enabled or not.

fixed_rrset_order_fqdns.description: The fixed RRset order FQDN. If this field does not contain an empty value, the appliance will automatically set the enable_fixed_rrset_order_fqdns field to 'true', unless the same request sets the enable field to 'false'.

nxdomain_redirect_ttl.description: The TTL value (in seconds) of synthetic DNS responses that result from NXDOMAIN redirection.

dns_health_check_recursion_flag.description: Determines if the recursive DNS health check is enabled or not.

ftc_expired_record_ttl.description: The TTL value (in seconds) of the expired Fault Tolerant Caching (FTC) record in DNS responses.

copy_xfer_to_notify.description: The allowed IPs, from the zone transfer list, added to the also-notify statement in the named.conf file.

dtc_dns_queries_specific_behavior.description: Setting to control specific behavior for DTC DNS responses for incoming lbdn matched queries.

transfers_per_ns.description: The number of maximum concurrent transfers per member. Valid values are unsigned integer between 2 and 10000, inclusive.

dns_health_check_interval.description: The time interval (in seconds) for DNS health check.

rpz_disable_nsdname_nsip.description: Determines if NSDNAME and NSIP resource records from RPZ feeds are enabled or not.

edns_udp_size.description: Advertises the EDNS0 buffer size to the upstream server. The value should be between 512 and 4096 bytes. The recommended value is between 512 and 1220 bytes.

sortlist.description: A sort list determines the order of addresses in responses made to DNS queries.

preserve_host_rrset_order_on_secondaries.description: Determines if the host RRset order on secondaries is preserved or not.

dnssec_trusted_keys.description: The list of trusted keys for the DNSSEC feature.

serial_query_rate.description: The number of maximum concurrent SOA queries per second. Valid values are unsigned integer between 20 and 1000, inclusive.

rpz_qname_wait_recurse.description: Determines if recursive RPZ lookups are enabled.

ddns_restrict_patterns_list.description: The unordered list of restriction patterns for an option of to restrict DDNS updates based on FQDN patterns.

rpz_drop_ip_rule_enabled.description: Enables the appliance to ignore RPZ-IP triggers with prefix lengths less than the specified minimum prefix length.

max_cached_lifetime.description: The maximum time (in seconds) a DNS response can be stored in the hardware acceleration cache. Valid values are unsigned integer between 60 and 86400, inclusive.

blacklist_redirect_ttl.description: The TTL value (in seconds) of the synthetic DNS responses that result from blacklist redirection.

ddns_restrict_protected.description: Determines if an option to restrict DDNS update request to protected resource records is enabled or disabled.

expire_after.description: The expiration time of a Grid DNS object. If the secondary DNS server fails to contact the primary server for the specified interval, the secondary server stops giving out answers about the zone because the zone data is too old to be useful.

ddns_restrict_patterns.description: Determines if an option to restrict DDNS update request based on FQDN patterns is enabled or disabled.

domains_to_capture_dns_queries.description: The list of domains for DNS query capture.

gss_tsig_keys.description: The list of GSS-TSIG keys for a Grid DNS object.

dnssec_key_params.description: This structure contains the DNSSEC key parameters for this zone.

enable_host_rrset_order.description: Determines if the host RRset order is enabled or not.

filter_aaaa.description: The type of AAAA filtering for this member DNS object.

file_transfer_setting.description: The DNS capture file transfer settings.Include the specified parameter to set the attribute value. Omit the parameter to retrieve the attribute value.

notify_source_port.description: The source port for notify messages. When requesting zone transfers from the primary server, some secondary DNS servers use the source port number (the primary server used to send the notify message) as the destination port number in the zone transfer request. Valid values are between 1 and 63999. The default is picked by BIND.

client_subnet_ipv6_prefix_length.description: Default IPv6 Source Prefix-Length used when sending queries with EDNS client subnet option.

copy_client_ip_mac_options.description: Copy custom IP, MAC and DNS View name ENDS0 options from incoming to outgoing recursive queries.

enable_query_source_port.description: Determines if the query source port at the Grid Level is enabled or not.

enable_dns_health_check.description: Determines if the DNS health check is enabled or not.

nxdomain_redirect_addresses_v6.description: The list of IPv6 NXDOMAIN redirection addresses.

max_cache_ttl.description: The maximum time (in seconds) for which the server will cache positive answers.

add_client_ip_mac_options.description: Add custom IP, MAC and DNS View name ENDS0 options to outgoing recursive queries.

allow_gss_tsig_zone_updates.description: Determines whether GSS-TSIG zone update is enabled for all Grid members.

protocol_record_name_policies.description: The list of record name policies.

ftc_expired_record_timeout.description: The timeout interval (in seconds) after which the expired Fault Tolerant Caching (FTC)record is stale and no longer valid.

enable_client_subnet_forwarding.description: Determines whether to enable forwarding EDNS client subnet options to upstream servers.

enable_fixed_rrset_order_fqdns.description: Determines if the fixed RRset order FQDN is enabled or not.

blacklist_action.description: The action to perform when a domain name matches the pattern defined in a rule that is specified by the blacklist ruleset.

dns_health_check_timeout.description: The DNS health check timeout interval (in seconds).

last_queried_acl.description: Determines last queried ACL for the specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks in scavenging settings.

allow_transfer.description: Determines if zone transfers from specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks or transfers from hosts authenticated by Transaction signature (TSIG) key are allowed or not.

public_key.description: The public key. The format of the returned value depends on the key algorithm.

flags.description: The flags field is a 16-bit unsigned integer. Currently, only two bits of this value are used: the least significant bit and bit 7. The other bits are reserved for future use and must be zero. If bit 7 is set to 1, the key is a DNS zone key. Otherwise, the key is not a zone key and cannot be used to verify zone data. The least significant bit indicates secure entry point property. If it is not zero, the key is a key signing key (KSK type). Otherwise, the key type is ZSK.

key_tag.description: The key tag identifying the public key of a DNSKEY Record object.

ms_ad_integrated.description: The flag that determines whether Active Directory is integrated or not. This field is valid only when ms_managed is STUB, AUTH_PRIMARY, or AUTH_BOTH.

ms_ddns_mode.description: Determines whether an Active Directory-integrated zone with a Microsoft DNS server as primary allows dynamic updates. Valid values are: SECURE if the zone allows secure updates only. NONE if the zone forbids dynamic updates. ANY if the zone accepts both secure and nonsecure updates. This field is valid only if ms_managed is either AUTH_PRIMARY or AUTH_BOTH. If the flag ms_ad_integrated is false, the value SECURE is not allowed.

external_ns_group.description: A forward stub server name server group.

soa_expire.description: This setting defines the amount of time, in seconds, after which the secondary server stops giving out answers about the zone because the zone data is too old to be useful.

ns_group.description: A stub member name server group.

prefix.description: The RFC2317 prefix value of this DNS zone. Use this field only when the netmask is greater than 24 bits; that is, for a mask between 25 and 31 bits. Enter a prefix, such as the name of the allocated address block. The prefix can be alphanumeric characters, such as 128/26 , 128-189 , or sub-B.

ms_managed.description: The flag that indicates whether the zone is assigned to a Microsoft DNS server. This flag returns the authoritative name server type of the Microsoft DNS server. Valid values are: NONE if the zone is not assigned to any Microsoft DNS server. STUB if the zone is assigned to a Microsoft DNS server as a stub zone. AUTH_PRIMARY if only the primary server of the zone is a Microsoft DNS server. AUTH_SECONDARY if only the secondary server of the zone is a Microsoft DNS server. AUTH_BOTH if both the primary and secondary servers of the zone are Microsoft DNS servers.

display_domain.description: The displayed name of the DNS zone.

disable_forwarding.description: Determines if the name servers that host the zone should not forward queries that end with the domain name of the zone to any configured forwarders.

soa_negative_ttl.description: The negative Time to Live (TTL) value of the SOA of the zone indicates how long a secondary server can cache data for Does Not Respond responses.

soa_mname.description: The SOA mname value for this zone. The Infoblox appliance allows you to change the name of the primary server on the SOA record that is automatically created when you initially configure a zone. Use this method to change the name of the primary server on the SOA record. For example, you may want to hide the primary server for a zone. If your device is named dns1.zone.tld, and for security reasons, you want to show a secondary server called dns2.zone.tld as the primary server. To do so, you would go to dns1.zone.tld zone (being the true primary) and change the primary server on the SOA to dns2.zone.tld to hide the true identity of the real primary server. This value can be in unicode format.

using_srg_associations.description: This is true if the zone is associated with a shared record group.

ms_read_only.description: Determines if a Grid member manages the zone served by a Microsoft DNS server in read-only mode. This flag is true when a Grid member manages the zone in read-only mode, false otherwise. When the zone has the ms_read_only flag set to True, no changes can be made to this zone.

parent.description: The parent zone of this zone. Note that when searching for reverse zones, the in-addr.arpa notation should be used.

stub_msservers.description: The Microsoft DNS servers of this stub zone. Note that the stealth field of the struct will be ignored when set in this field.

soa_refresh.description: This indicates the interval at which a secondary server sends a message to the primary server for a zone to check that its data is current, and retrieve fresh data if it is not.

disable.description: Determines whether a zone is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the zone is enabled.

address.description: The IP address of the server that is serving this zone.

soa_serial_number.description: The serial number in the SOA record incrementally changes every time the record is modified. The Infoblox appliance allows you to change the serial number (in the SOA record) for the primary server so it is higher than the secondary server, thereby ensuring zone transfers come from the primary server.

soa_retry.description: This indicates how long a secondary server must wait before attempting to recontact the primary server after a connection failure between the two servers occurs.

nxdomain_log_query.description: The flag that indicates whether NXDOMAIN redirection queries are logged. Specify true to enable logging, or false to disable it. The default value is false.

You can either select and use Internet root name servers or specify custom root name servers by providing a host name and IP address to which the Infoblox appliance can send queries. disable.description: Determines if the DNS view is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the DNS view is enabled.

forwarders.description: The list of forwarders for the DNS view. A forwarder is a name server to which other name servers first send their off-site queries. The forwarder builds up a cache of information, avoiding the need for other name servers to send queries off-site.

network_view.description: The name of the network view object associated with this DNS view.

blacklist_redirect_addresses.description: The array of IP addresses the appliance includes in the response it sends in place of a blacklisted IP address.

name.description: Name of the DNS view.

nxdomain_redirect_addresses.description: The array with IPv4 addresses the appliance includes in the response it sends in place of an NXDOMAIN response.

enable_fixed_rrset_order_fqdns.description: Determines if the fixed RRset order FQDN is enabled or not.

nxdomain_rulesets.description: The names of the Ruleset objects assigned at the grid level for NXDOMAIN redirection.

max_ncache_ttl.description: The maximum number of seconds to cache negative (NXDOMAIN) answers.

last_queried_acl.description: Determines last queried ACL for the specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks in scavenging settings.

nxdomain_redirect.description: Determines if NXDOMAIN redirection in a DNS view is enabled or not.

edns_udp_size.description: Advertises the EDNS0 buffer size to the upstream server. The value should be between 512 and 4096 bytes. The recommended value is between 512 and 1220 bytes.

comment.description: Comment for the zone; maximum 256 characters.

rpz_priority_end.description: This number is for UI to identify the end of qualified zone list.

dns_soa_email.description: The SOA email for the zone in punycode format.

soa_expire.description: This setting defines the amount of time, in seconds, after which the secondary server stops giving out answers about the zone because the zone data is too old to be useful. The default is one week.

ns_group.description: The name server group that serves DNS for this zone.

rpz_last_updated_time.description: The timestamp of the last update for zone data.

prefix.description: The RFC2317 prefix value of this DNS zone. Use this field only when the netmask is greater than 24 bits; that is, for a mask between 25 and 31 bits. Enter a prefix, such as the name of the allocated address block. The prefix can be alphanumeric characters, such as 128/26 , 128-189 , or sub-B.

rpz_drop_ip_rule_enabled.description: Enables the appliance to ignore RPZ-IP triggers with prefix lengths less than the specified minimum prefix length.

use_grid_zone_timer.description: Use flag for: soa_default_ttl , soa_expire, soa_negative_ttl, soa_refresh, soa_retry

rpz_policy.description: The response policy zone override policy.

display_domain.description: The displayed name of the DNS zone.

rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv6.description: The minimum prefix length for IPv6 RPZ-IP triggers. The appliance ignores RPZ-IP triggers with prefix lengths less than the specified minimum IPv6 prefix length.

rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv4.description: The minimum prefix length for IPv4 RPZ-IP triggers. The appliance ignores RPZ-IP triggers with prefix lengths less than the specified minimum IPv4 prefix length.

external_primaries.description: The list of external primary servers.

soa_negative_ttl.description: The negative Time to Live (TTL) value of the SOA of the zone indicates how long a secondary server can cache data for Does Not Respond responses.

log_rpz.description: Determines whether RPZ logging enabled or not at zone level. When this is set to False, the logging is disabled.

soa_refresh.description: This indicates the interval at which a secondary server sends a message to the primary server for a zone to check that its data is current, and retrieve fresh data if it is not.

set_soa_serial_number.description: The serial number in the SOA record incrementally changes every time the record is modified. The Infoblox appliance allows you to change the serial number (in the SOA record) for the primary server so it is higher than the secondary server, thereby ensuring zone transfers come from the primary server (as they should). To change the serial number you need to set a new value at soa_serial_number and pass set_soa_serial_number as True.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

rpz_severity.description: The severity of this response policy zone.

primary_type.description: The type of the primary server.

parent.description: The parent zone of this zone. Note that when searching for reverse zones, the in-addr.arpa notation should be used.

member_soa_serials.description: The list of per-member SOA serial information.

member_soa_mnames.description: The list of per-member SOA MNAME information.

disable.description: Determines whether a zone is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the zone is enabled.

grid_secondaries.description: The list with Grid members that are secondary servers for this zone.

soa_default_ttl.description: The Time to Live (TTL) value of the SOA record of this zone. This value is the number of seconds that data is cached.

soa_serial_number.description: The serial number in the SOA record incrementally changes every time the record is modified. The Infoblox appliance allows you to change the serial number (in the SOA record) for the primary server so it is higher than the secondary server, thereby ensuring zone transfers come from the primary server (as they should). To change the serial number you need to set a new value at soa_serial_number and pass set_soa_serial_number as True.

locked.description: If you enable this flag, other administrators cannot make conflicting changes. This is for administration purposes only. The zone will continue to serve DNS data even when it is locked.

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which this zone resides.

grid_primary.description: The grid primary servers for this zone.

soa_retry.description: This indicates how long a secondary server must wait before attempting to recontact the primary server after a connection failure between the two servers occurs.

external_secondaries.description: The list of external secondary servers.

locked_by.description: The name of a superuser or the administrator who locked this zone.

fqdn.description: The name of this DNS zone in FQDN format.

rpz_priority.description: The priority of this response policy zone.

use_rpz_drop_ip_rule.description: Use flag for: rpz_drop_ip_rule_enabled , rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv4, rpz_drop_ip_rule_min_prefix_length_ipv6

use_external_primary.description: This flag controls whether the zone is using an external primary.

soa_email.description: The SOA email value for this zone. This value can be in unicode format.

mask_prefix.description: IPv4 Netmask or IPv6 prefix for this zone.

substitute_name.description: The canonical name of redirect target in substitute policy of response policy zone.

record_name_policy.description: The hostname policy for records under this zone.

address.description: The IP address of the server that is serving this zone.

view.description: The name of the DNS view in which the zone resides. Example external.

allow_update_forwarding.description: The list with IP addresses, networks or TSIG keys for clients, from which forwarded dynamic updates are allowed.

ddns_restrict_static.description: The flag that indicates whether an option to restrict DDNS update request to resource records which are marked as 'STATIC' is enabled or disabled.

notify_delay.description: The number of seconds in delay with which notify messages are sent to secondaries.

import_from.description: The IP address of the Infoblox appliance from which zone data is imported. Setting this address to '255.255.255.255' and do_host_abstraction to 'true' will create Host records from A records in this zone without importing zone data.

allow_query.description: Determines whether DNS queries are allowed from a named ACL, or from a list of IPv4/IPv6 addresses, networks, and TSIG keys for the hosts.

prefix.description: The RFC2317 prefix value of this DNS zone. Use this field only when the netmask is greater than 24 bits; that is, for a mask between 25 and 31 bits. Enter a prefix, such as the name of the allocated address block. The prefix can be alphanumeric characters, such as 128/26 , 128-189 , or sub-B.

ms_managed.description: The flag that indicates whether the zone is assigned to a Microsoft DNS server. This flag returns the authoritative name server type of the Microsoft DNS server. Valid values are: NONE if the zone is not assigned to any Microsoft DNS server. STUB if the zone is assigned to a Microsoft DNS server as a stub zone. AUTH_PRIMARY if only the primary server of the zone is a Microsoft DNS server. AUTH_SECONDARY if only the secondary server of the zone is a Microsoft DNS server. AUTH_BOTH if both the primary and secondary servers of the zone are Microsoft DNS servers.

create_ptr_for_hosts.description: Determines if PTR records are created for hosts automatically, if necessary, when the zone data is imported. This field is meaningful only when import_from is set.

use_check_names_policy.description: Apply policy to dynamic updates and inbound zone transfers (This value applies only if the host name restriction policy is set to Strict Hostname Checking.)

ms_secondaries.description: The list with the Microsoft DNS servers that are secondary servers for the zone.

set_soa_serial_number.description: The serial number in the SOA record incrementally changes every time the record is modified. The Infoblox appliance allows you to change the serial number (in the SOA record) for the primary server so it is higher than the secondary server, thereby ensuring zone transfers come from the primary server (as they should). To change the serial number you need to set a new value at soa_serial_number and pass set_soa_serial_number as True.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

using_srg_associations.description: This is true if the zone is associated with a shared record group.

ms_ddns_mode.description: Determines whether an Active Directory-integrated zone with a Microsoft DNS server as primary allows dynamic updates. Valid values are: SECURE if the zone allows secure updates only. NONE if the zone forbids dynamic updates. ANY if the zone accepts both secure and nonsecure updates. This field is valid only if ms_managed is either AUTH_PRIMARY or AUTH_BOTH. If the flag ms_ad_integrated is false, the value SECURE is not allowed.

srgs.description: The associated shared record groups of a DNS zone. If a shared record group is associated with a zone, then all shared records in a shared record group will be shared in the zone.

use_grid_zone_timer.description: Use flag for: soa_default_ttl , soa_expire, soa_negative_ttl, soa_refresh, soa_retry

soa_default_ttl.description: The Time to Live (TTL) value of the SOA record of this zone. This value is the number of seconds that data is cached.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

use_ddns_principal_security.description: Use flag for: ddns_restrict_secure , ddns_principal_tracking, ddns_principal_group

dns_fqdn.description: The name of this DNS zone in punycode format. For a reverse zone, this is in address/cidr format. For other zones, this is in FQDN format in punycode format.

soa_retry.description: This indicates how long a secondary server must wait before attempting to recontact the primary server after a connection failure between the two servers occurs.

use_external_primary.description: This flag controls whether the zone is using an external primary.

locked_by.description: The name of a superuser or the administrator who locked this zone.

ns_group.description: The name server group that serves DNS for this zone.

is_multimaster.description: Determines if multi-master DNS is enabled for the zone.

ms_sync_master_name.description: The name of MS synchronization master for this zone.

ms_primaries.description: The list with the Microsoft DNS servers that are primary servers for the zone. Although a zone typically has just one primary name server, you can specify up to ten independent servers for a single zone.

record_name_policy.description: The hostname policy for records under this zone.

allow_active_dir.description: This field allows the zone to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated DDNS updates from DHCP clients and servers in an AD domain. Note that addresses specified in this field ignore the permission set in the struct which will be set to 'ALLOW'.

last_queried.description: The time the zone was last queried on.

rr_not_queried_enabled_time.description: The time data collection for Not Queried Resource Record was enabled for this zone.

ddns_principal_group.description: The DDNS Principal cluster group name.

create_ptr_for_bulk_hosts.description: Determines if PTR records are created for hosts automatically, if necessary, when the zone data is imported. This field is meaningful only when import_from is set.

zone_not_queried_enabled_time.description: The time when DNS Zones Last Queried was turned on for this zone.

is_dnssec_signed.description: Determines if the zone is DNSSEC signed.

display_domain.description: The displayed name of the DNS zone.

external_primaries.description: The list of external primary servers.

ms_allow_transfer_mode.description: Determines which DNS clients are allowed to perform zone transfers from a Microsoft DNS server. Valid values are: ADDRESS_AC, to use ms_allow_transfer field for specifying IP addresses, networks and Transaction Signature (TSIG) keys for clients that are allowed to do zone transfers. ANY, to allow any client. ANY_NS, to allow only the nameservers listed in this zone. NONE, to deny all zone transfer requests.

records_monitored.description: Determines if this zone is also monitoring resource records.

ms_read_only.description: Determines if a Grid member manages the zone served by a Microsoft DNS server in read-only mode. This flag is true when a Grid member manages the zone in read-only mode, false otherwise. When the zone has the ms_read_only flag set to True, no changes can be made to this zone.

parent.description: The parent zone of this zone. Note that when searching for reverse zones, the in-addr.arpa notation should be used.

create_underscore_zones.description: Determines whether automatic creation of subzones is enabled or not.

zone_format.description: Determines the format of this zone.

soa_email.description: The SOA email value for this zone. This value can be in unicode format.

dnssec_zsk_rollover_date.description: The rollover date for the Zone Signing Key.

grid_secondaries.description: The list with Grid members that are secondary servers for this zone.

ddns_principal_tracking.description: The flag that indicates whether the DDNS principal track is enabled or disabled.

soa_serial_number.description: The serial number in the SOA record incrementally changes every time the record is modified. The Infoblox appliance allows you to change the serial number (in the SOA record) for the primary server so it is higher than the secondary server, thereby ensuring zone transfers come from the primary server (as they should). To change the serial number you need to set a new value at soa_serial_number and pass set_soa_serial_number as True.

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which this zone resides.

fqdn.description: The name of this DNS zone. For a reverse zone, this is in address/cidr format. For other zones, this is in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format. Note that for a reverse zone, the corresponding zone_format value should be set.

view.description: The name of the DNS view in which the zone resides. Example external.

comment.description: Comment for the zone; maximum 256 characters.

dnssec_ksk_rollover_date.description: The rollover date for the Key Signing Key.

address.description: The IP address of the server that is serving this zone.

allow_update.description: Determines whether dynamic DNS updates are allowed from a named ACL, or from a list of IPv4/IPv6 addresses, networks, and TSIG keys for the hosts.

disable_forwarding.description: Determines whether the name servers that host the zone should forward queries (ended with the domain name of the zone) to any configured forwarders.

dns_integrity_frequency.description: The frequency, in seconds, of DNS integrity checks for this zone.

ddns_restrict_secure.description: The flag that indicates whether DDNS update request for principal other than target resource record's principal is restricted.

dnssec_keys.description: A list of DNSSEC keys for the zone.

effective_record_name_policy.description: The selected hostname policy for records under this zone.

soa_refresh.description: This indicates the interval at which a secondary server sends a message to the primary server for a zone to check that its data is current, and retrieve fresh data if it is not.

network_associations.description: The list with the associated network/network container information.

is_dnssec_enabled.description: This flag is set to True if DNSSEC is enabled for the zone.

soa_expire.description: This setting defines the amount of time, in seconds, after which the secondary server stops giving out answers about the zone because the zone data is too old to be useful. The default is one week.

dns_integrity_verbose_logging.description: If this is set to True, more information is logged for DNS integrity checks for this zone.

soa_negative_ttl.description: The negative Time to Live (TTL) value of the SOA of the zone indicates how long a secondary server can cache data for Does Not Respond responses.

ms_sync_disabled.description: This flag controls whether this zone is synchronized with Microsoft DNS servers.

effective_check_names_policy.description: The value of the check names policy, which indicates the action the appliance takes when it encounters host names that do not comply with the Strict Hostname Checking policy. This value applies only if the host name restriction policy is set to Strict Hostname Checking.

copy_xfer_to_notify.description: If this flag is set to True then copy allowed IPs from Allow Transfer to Also Notify.

locked.description: If you enable this flag, other administrators cannot make conflicting changes. This is for administration purposes only. The zone will continue to serve DNS data even when it is locked.

ddns_force_creation_timestamp_update.description: Defines whether creation timestamp of RR should be updated ' when DDNS update happens even if there is no change to ' the RR.

grid_primary.description: The grid primary servers for this zone.

do_host_abstraction.description: Determines if hosts and bulk hosts are automatically created when the zone data is imported. This field is meaningful only when import_from is set.

mask_prefix.description: IPv4 Netmask or IPv6 prefix for this zone.

external_secondaries.description: The list of external secondary servers.

ms_ad_integrated.description: The flag that determines whether Active Directory is integrated or not. This field is valid only when ms_managed is STUB, AUTH_PRIMARY, or AUTH_BOTH.

dns_integrity_member.description: The Grid member that performs DNS integrity checks for this zone.

grid_primary_shared_with_ms_parent_deleg.description: Determines if the server is duplicated with parent delegation.

ddns_restrict_patterns_list.description: The unordered list of restriction patterns for an option of to restrict DDNS updates based on FQDN patterns.

ddns_restrict_protected.description: The flag that indicates whether an option to restrict DDNS update request to protected resource records is enabled or disabled.

ddns_restrict_patterns.description: The flag that indicates whether an option to restrict DDNS update request based on FQDN patterns is enabled or disabled.

ms_allow_transfer.description: The list of DNS clients that are allowed to perform zone transfers from a Microsoft DNS server. This setting applies only to zones with Microsoft DNS servers that are either primary or secondary servers. This setting does not inherit any value from the Grid or from any member that defines an allow_transfer value. This setting does not apply to any grid member. Use the allow_transfer field to control which DNS clients are allowed to perform zone transfers on Grid members.

dnssec_key_params.description: This structure contains the DNSSEC key parameters for this zone.

allow_fixed_rrset_order.description: The flag that allows to enable or disable fixed RRset ordering for authoritative forward-mapping zones.

member_soa_mnames.description: The list of per-member SOA MNAME information.

allow_gss_tsig_for_underscore_zone.description: The flag that allows DHCP clients to perform GSS-TSIG signed updates for underscore zones.

primary_type.description: The type of the primary server.

member_soa_serials.description: The list of per-member SOA serial information.

disable.description: Determines whether a zone is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the zone is enabled.

dns_soa_email.description: The SOA email for the zone in punycode format.

allow_gss_tsig_zone_updates.description: The flag that enables or disables the zone for GSS-TSIG updates.

ms_dc_ns_record_creation.description: The list of domain controllers that are allowed to create NS records for authoritative zones.

dns_integrity_enable.description: If this is set to True, DNS integrity check is enabled for this zone.

last_queried_acl.description: Determines last queried ACL for the specified IPv4 or IPv6 addresses and networks in scavenging settings.

update_forwarding.description: Use this field to allow or deny dynamic DNS updates that are forwarded from specific IPv4/IPv6 addresses, networks, or a named ACL. You can also provide TSIG keys for clients that are allowed or denied to perform zone updates. This setting overrides the member-level setting.

allow_transfer.description: Determines whether zone transfers are allowed from a named ACL, or from a list of IPv4/IPv6 addresses, networks, and TSIG keys for the hosts.

type_covered.description: The RR type covered by the RRSIG record.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

labels.description: The number of labels in the name of the RRset signed with the RRSIG object.

name.description: The name of the RRSIG record in FQDN format.

algorithm.description: The cryptographic algorithm that was used to create the signature. It uses the same algorithm types as the DNSKEY record indicated in the key tag field.

creator.description: The record creator.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for the record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

dns_name.description: Name for an RRSIG record in punycode format.

dns_signer_name.description: The domain name, in punycode format, of the zone that contains the signed RRset.

creation_time.description: The creation time of the record.

signature.description: The Base64 encoded cryptographic signature that covers the RRSIG RDATA of the RRSIG Record object.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

key_tag.description: The key tag value of the DNSKEY RR that validates the signature.

original_ttl.description: The TTL value of the RRset covered by the RRSIG record.

inception_time.description: The inception time of an RRSIG record in Epoch seconds format.

expiration_time.description: The expiry time of an RRSIG record in Epoch seconds format.

signer_name.description: The domain name of the zone in FQDN format that contains the signed RRset.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

view.description: The name of the DNS View in which the record resides. Example: external.
